and the Jutland peninsula. Nationally its main claim to fame is that, the first potatoes of the year hail from the island. It has more recently garnered international attention since the heat and energy used on the island is exclusively produced by renewable sources.
While it is possible to grab a taxi flight from
to the islands small airfield, the 2900 DKK Samair
charges for single flight with up to 3 passengers, leaves the vast majority taking one of the island's two ferries.

on the islands west coast up to seven times per day between 6.40 and 20.15 on weekdays. The crossing takes an hour and fifteen minutes.  Tickets costs 98 DKK for a one way passenger ticket, and 281 DKK for a car. To Kalundborg there is direct train connections from
